PUBLIC "-//Duke University::David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library//TEXT (US::NDD::::Pre-1870 Newspaper Collection)//EN" "newspapr.xml" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.xsl (sy2003-10-15).

Also, the top level of the finding aid (above the dsc) changed to conform to current Rubenstein Library and NC EAD standards as laid out in the Inventory Style Guide and in the NCEAD Best Practice Guidelines. Within the dsc, dates for series were normalized. These changes were made by Michelle Belden.
Also, container TYPE and LABEL attribute values were standardized according to the Rubenstein Library EAD 2002 manual and the NCEAD eadlocal.ent by Ruth E. Bryan.
The tag list inside index was changed to indexentry by Ruth E. Bryan.

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.
The newspapers are very fragile: handle with extreme care on a spacious, flat surface. Reference staff must be consulted before any photocopying is done.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Pre-1870 Newspaper Collection, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: Transferred from Perkins Library to the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library in 1997 and 1998.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Paula Jeannet and Trey McClean
This collection is unprocessed: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Recent uncataloged accessions of Pre-1870 newspapers, transferred from Perkins Library to the Rare Book Manuscript and Special Collections Library at Duke University in 1997 and 1998. The bulk of this collection consists of papers published in the South during the Civil War, but several newspapers from Northern states are also included. The papers in this collection are very fragile and should be used with extreme care. Please consult with reference staff prior to photocopying.

did.unittitle: Newspaper Collection

scopecontent.p: Uncataloged pre-1870 newspapers received in1996 from the Serials Department of Perkins Library. Dates range from 1830-1887,with the bulk of the issues published from1861 to1869. The majority originate from North Carolina cities, but the states of Massachusetts, New York, South Carolina, Mississippi, Kentucky, Pennsylvania, and Maine are also represented. Newspapers are in numbered folders. Many are very fragile: handle with extreme care on a spacious, flat surface. Reference staff must be consulted before any photocopying is done.

scopecontent.p: Uncataloged pre-1870 newspapers transferred form the Serials Department of Perkins Library to the Rubenstein Library in1998.The newspapers in this addition span1833 to1885,chiefly the1860s.The bulk of this addition are issues of the Memphis Daily Appeal, (Atlanta, GA) from 1862-1865.Newspapers from Texas, Vermont, and Tennessee are also included in this portion of the collection. The newspaper are in numbered folders. Many of the news paper are very fragile and should be used only on a large flat space. Consult with reference staff prior to photocopying.
